pli-tv-kd7:0.3: The chapter on the robe-making procedure
pli-tv-kd7:0.4: The allowance for a robe-making procedure
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.2: At that time thirty monks from Pāvā—all wilderness-dwellers, almsfood-only eaters, rag-robe wearers, and three-robe owners—were traveling to Sāvatthī to visit the Buddha. Because the entry to the rainy-season residence was approaching, they were not able to reach Sāvatthī,
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.3: and they entered the rains residence at Sāketa while still on their way.
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.4: They spent the rains residence discontented, thinking, “The Buddha is only 80 kilometers away, but we don’t get to see him.”
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.5: When they had completed the rainy-season residence and done the invitation procedure at the end of the three months, it was raining, water was accumulating, and it was muddy. As they traveled to Sāvatthī, their robes were soaked. They became exhausted.
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.6: When they arrived at Sāvatthī, they went to Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery, bowed to the Buddha, and sat down.
pli-tv-kd7:1.2.1: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks,
pli-tv-kd7:1.2.3: “I hope you’re keeping well, monks, I hope you’re comfortable;
pli-tv-kd7:1.2.4: I hope you had a comfortable rains residence, in concord and harmony, without dispute, and that you had no trouble getting almsfood?”
pli-tv-kd7:1.2.5: “We’re keeping well, Venerable Sir, we’re comfortable;
pli-tv-kd7:1.2.6: we had a comfortable rains residence, in concord and harmony, without dispute, and we had no trouble getting almsfood.”
pli-tv-kd7:1.2.7: And they told the Buddha what had happened during the rains and while traveling to Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-kd7:1.3.1: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd7:1.3.2: “I allow monks who have completed the rainy-season residence to do a robe-making procedure.
pli-tv-kd7:1.3.3: Once you have participated in the robe-making procedure, five things are allowable for you:
pli-tv-kd7:1.3.4: visiting families before or after a meal invitation, staying apart from your robe for more than a day, eating in a group, keeping as much extra robe-cloth as you need, and whatever robe-cloth is given is only for those who have participated in the robe-making procedure.
pli-tv-kd7:1.3.6: And the robe-making procedure should be done like this.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.1: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.2: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.3: This cloth has been given to the Sangha for the robe-making procedure.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.4: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give this cloth to monk so-and-so to do the robe-making procedure.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.6: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.7: This cloth has been given to the Sangha for the robe-making procedure.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.8: The Sangha gives this cloth to monk so-and-so to do the robe-making procedure.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.9: Any monk who approves of giving this cloth to monk so-and-so to do the robe-making procedure should remain silent.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.10: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.11: The Sangha has given this cloth to monk so-and-so to do the robe-making procedure.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.12: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.2: “And, monks, how has the robe-making procedure not been done?
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.3: The robe-making procedure hasn’t been done merely by marking the cloth,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.7: merely by a tacking the cloth,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.9: merely by marking with a strip of cloth,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.11: merely by adding a border lengthwise,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.12: merely by adding a border crosswise,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.15: nor has it been done if a monk has made an indication,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.16: if a monk has given a hint,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.17: if the robe has been borrowed,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.19: if it is to be relinquished,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.21: if it’s not an outer robe
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.24: nor has it been done if the robe hasn’t been made on that very day with five or more cut sections with panels,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.25: if the robe-making procedure isn’t done by an individual,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.26: or if the appreciation for the procedure is expressed by someone outside the monastic boundary.
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.27: In this way the robe-making procedure hasn’t been done.
pli-tv-kd7:1.6.1: And how has the robe-making procedure been done?
pli-tv-kd7:1.6.2: The robe-making procedure has been done if the cloth is brand new, if it’s nearly new, if it’s old, if it’s a rag, if it’s from a shop; it has been done if a monk hasn’t given a sign, if a monk hasn’t given a hint, if the robe hasn’t been borrowed, if it hasn’t been stored, if it’s not to be relinquished, if it has been marked, if it’s an outer robe or an upper robe or a sarong; it has been done if the robe has been made on that very day with five or more cut sections with panels, if the robe-making procedure is done by an individual, and if the appreciation for the procedure is expressed by someone inside the monastic boundary.
pli-tv-kd7:1.6.3: In this way the robe-making procedure has been done.
pli-tv-kd7:1.7.1: And how does the robe-making season come to an end?
pli-tv-kd7:1.7.2: There are these eight summaries for when the robe-making season comes to an end:
pli-tv-kd7:1.7.3: when he departs from the monastery, when the robe is finished, when he makes a decision, when the robe-cloth is lost, when he hears about the end of the robe-making season, when an expectation of more robe-cloth is thwarted, when he is outside the monastic boundary, when the robe-making season comes to an end together.”
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.1: A monk who has participated in the robe-making procedure takes a finished robe and leaves the monastery, thinking, “I won’t return.”
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.2: For that monk the robe-making season comes to an end when he departs from the monastery.
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.3: A monk who has participated in the robe-making procedure takes robe-cloth and leaves the monastery.
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.4: When he is outside the monastic boundary, he thinks, “I’ll make the robe right here; I won’t return.”
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.5: He then has the robe made.
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.6: For that monk the robe-making season comes to an end when the robe is finished.
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.7: A monk who has participated in the robe-making procedure takes robe-cloth and leaves the monastery.
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.8: When he is outside the monastic boundary, he thinks, “I won’t make a robe, and I won’t return.”
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.9: For that monk the robe-making season comes to an end when he makes that decision.
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.10: A monk who has participated in the robe-making procedure takes robe-cloth and leaves the monastery.
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.11: When he is outside the monastic boundary, he thinks, “I’ll make the robe right here; I won’t return.”
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.12: He has the robe made, but it is lost while being made.
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.13: For that monk the robe-making season comes to an end when the robe-cloth is lost.
pli-tv-kd7:2.2.1: A monk who has participated in the robe-making procedure takes robe-cloth and leaves the monastery, thinking, “I’ll return.”
pli-tv-kd7:2.2.2: When he is outside the monastic boundary, he has the robe made.
pli-tv-kd7:2.2.3: When the robe has been made, he hears that they have made an end to the robe-making season in that monastery.
pli-tv-kd7:2.2.4: For that monk the robe-making season comes to an end when he hears about the end of the robe-making season.
pli-tv-kd7:2.2.5: A monk who has participated in the robe-making procedure takes robe-cloth and leaves the monastery, thinking, “I’ll return.”
pli-tv-kd7:2.2.6: When he is outside the monastic boundary, he has the robe made.
pli-tv-kd7:2.2.7: When the robe has been made, he still thinks, “I’ll return,” but he remains outside the monastery boundary until the end of the robe-making season.
pli-tv-kd7:2.2.8: For that monk the robe-making season comes to an end while he is outside the monastic boundary.

pli-tv-kd7:2.2.12: For that monk the robe-making season comes to an end together with the other monks.
pli-tv-kd7:2.2.13: The group of seven on “takes” is finished.

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.0: The group of nine on “without taking”
pli-tv-kd7:11.1.1: A monk who has participated in the robe-making procedure leaves the monastery for the districts without taking his share of robe-cloth.
pli-tv-kd7:11.1.2: When he has gone to the districts, the monks there ask him, “Where did you complete the rains residence? Where is your share of robe-cloth?”
pli-tv-kd7:11.1.3: He replies, “I completed the rains residence in such-and-such a monastery. That’s where my share of robe-cloth is.”
pli-tv-kd7:11.1.4: They say, “Go and get that robe-cloth, and we’ll make a robe for you.”
pli-tv-kd7:11.1.5: He then goes to that monastery and asks the monks, “Where is my share of the robe-cloth?”

pli-tv-kd7:13.1.0: Discussion on obstacles and removal of obstacles
pli-tv-kd7:13.1.1: “Monks, there are two obstacles for the ending of the robe-making season:
pli-tv-kd7:13.1.3: the monastery obstacle and the robe obstacle.
pli-tv-kd7:13.1.5: A monk stays in that monastery or he leaves intending to return.
pli-tv-kd7:13.1.8: A monk hasn’t made a robe, or he hasn’t finished it, or he is expecting more robe-cloth.
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.1: There are two removals of obstacles for the ending of the robe-making season:
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.2: the removal of the monastery obstacle and the removal of the robe obstacle.
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.3: What is the removal of the monastery obstacle?
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.4: A monk leaves that monastery without intending to return.
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.6: What is the removal of the robe obstacle?
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.7: A monk has made a robe; or the robe-cloth is lost, stolen, or burnt; or his expectation of more robe-cloth is thwarted.”
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.10: The seventh chapter on the robe-making procedure is finished.
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.124: In this chapter there are one hundred and eighteen topics by means of groups of twelve with repetition.
